intro: Heleastrum paludosum, commonly known as swamp spikerush, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in North America. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in shallow, freshwater marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its tall, cylindrical inflorescence consists of numerous small, spike-like clusters of flowers. Heleastrum paludosum plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
